metadata.title: ICSE Cognitive Level Distribution - Post 2020 Reform Trajectory
metadata.source: CISCE Official Circulars, Specimen Papers, NEP 2020 Implementation

reform_trigger.goal: Shift from rote-learning to competency-based assessment

year_on_year_trajectory.context: COVID-era papers; syllabus reduced by 30%; no structural HOT change
year_on_year_trajectory.notable_changes: Syllabus reduction only; cognitive level unchanged

year_on_year_trajectory.context: NEP 2020 influence begins; CISCE internal discussions on reform
year_on_year_trajectory.notable_changes: Minor uptick in Analysis-level questions in English and Physics

year_on_year_trajectory.context: CISCE formal circular issued on HOT increase from 2024
First year of visible HOT shift; item banks under development
year_on_year_trajectory.notable_changes: Case-based and data interpretation Qs introduced in Section B

year_on_year_trajectory.context: CISCE releases official subject-wise Item Banks tagged with Bloom's levels
year_on_year_trajectory.notable_changes: Item Banks published; paper setters formally required to use Bloom's tags

new_question_formats_post2020.description: Real-world scenario given; students analyze and respond
Graphs, tables, experimental data for analysis
Tests why not just what; both assertion and reason evaluated
Primary source excerpts with Analysis/Evaluation sub-parts
Select answer AND write brief reasoning

item_banks_initiative.description: CISCE published subject-wise item banks with Bloom's Taxonomy level tags
item_banks_initiative.significance: First time CISCE formally published Bloom's-mapped question sets; paper setters required to use cognitive-level tags from 2025
